markdown.markdown:
```{=html}

<iframe src="https://ps52007d.littlemonkeylab.com/slides/week05/lecture.slides.html" title="Week XX Lecture" width="960" height="500" data-external="1"></iframe>
```
## Introduction & Lecture Preview

::: {.callout .primary}
**Key Focus:** Understanding the errors of the past
:::

-   **Important Points:**
    1.  The quality of prior research can be estimated by re-testing the
        hypotheses
    2.  It's not a pretty picture
-   **Preparatory Reading or Thinking:**
    -   Power Textbook chapter available on the VLE

## Lab Sessions

```{=html}

<iframe src="https://ps52007d.littlemonkeylab.com/slides/week05/lab.slides.html" title="Week XX lab overview" width="960" height="500" data-external="1"></iframe>
```
## Primary Thought

-   You will be required to use your Critical Proposal Effect Size (and
    maybe others) to calculate a Required Sample Size via a Power
    Calculation. The software G\*Power will be used to do this. Step by
    Step guidance is offered to assist you with this.

### Main Lab Activities

-   Identify your ANOVA flavour and familiarise yourself with the
    elements included in the calculation

### Module Milestones (by end of this week)

-   Your Critical Proposal is due on Friday. You should have finalised
    your choice of Target Paper.

### Reflection and Meta-Cognitive Practice

You have had a very successful start to the term. When we re-assemble
after Reading Week, we will begin the process of bringing your studies
to life. It will be fun, but come back ready to get after it.

language.appendix-attribution-cite-as: For attribution, please cite this work as:

instructor.name: Dr. Gordon Wright
instructor.contact_policy: E-mail is the best ways to get in contact with me. I will try to respond to all course-related e-mails within 24 hours. Any questions relating to the course, coursework or anything not personal/confidential in nature should be submitted to the Course Forum. This benefits all students. So, if you email me about the course, don't be surprised if you get a brief 'Please post this to the Forum' message!   Office hours are advertised on the module VLE page.
